DOC.brief_title: ANG1005 Patients With Recurrent High-Grade Glioma
DOC.criteria: 1 . ≥ 18 year old 2 . GBM GBM variant , WHO Grade III anaplastic glioma diagnosis confirm 3 . Radiologically confirm recurrent bidimensionally measurable disease per Response Assessment NeuroOncology ( RANO ) criteria 4 . Neurologically stable 5 . For bevacizumabrefractory patient , radiologic demonstration tumor progression bevacizumab therapy 6 . Karnofsky performance status ( KPS ) ≥ 70 1 . More three relapse 2 . Previous ANG1005/GRN1005 treatment 3 . Radiotherapy within 3 month . 4 . Therapy bevacizumab within 4 week prior screen recurrent WHO grade III anaplastic glioma patient ( Arm 3 ) 5 . Evidence significant intracranial hemorrhage 6 . Previous taxane treatment 7 . Prior therapy bevacizumab bevacizumabnaïve patient ( Arm 1 ) 8 . NCI Common Toxicity Criteria Adverse Effects ( CTCAE ) v4.0 Grade ≥ 2 neuropathy 9 . Inadequate bone marrow reserve
